turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Forged papers! Now, what?!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Now just get off the train.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: HUH?!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You must enjoy causing me pain!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You shouldn't have pushed us!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You never said anything to me about having to prove I'm a Princess!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You are the Princess.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Every Russian family has one..

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Natasha! Natasha Feastavich!- but we called her Nashie Fooshie!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: ...fish fork, salad fork, meat fork and. . .  [THIS SECTION ALSO NOT LEDGABLE]

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: It's the best fork of all

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: The dessert fork!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: What a beautiful ship!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: It used to be a private yacht before the government took it over.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: You said you wouldn't laugh!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: It's not you - it's the dress!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: It's so beautiful ... and sad.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Sad?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Lost. it feels lost. This was hers?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Yeah ... well, yours. You still don't believe that you're the Princess, do you?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I know I must have had something to do with the palace - I've had little flashes of things - but being the Princess? It doesn't matter as long as I find my home.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Well, the only thing you've got when you've got a home is a fear of losing it! You're lucky you don't remember the revolution -- I never had much, but what I did have -- I lost.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Hey! It doesn't matter! You gotta make your own way in the world! Don't be sorry for me! I'm going to get what I want don't you worry!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Oh! I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: It's okay. Didn't hurt..

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Yes - If I can't convince Sophie, I'll never be able to see Tatiana....

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You'll convince her. You have the qualities of a princess you're poised and strong... and beautiful ... even if you forget a couple dates of family names - she'll know.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm so scared...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Don't be

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Anya, wait!

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Tell me it isn't true?! Tell me you didn't do this for the money!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: No! Well, yes, but

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No! I thought you believed in me! It was all a lie!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I'm glad you found what you were looking for.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I'm glad you	did too.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Dmitri?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Anya... where are we?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Don't let me go!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I'll never let go!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Who are you, child?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I don't know! I don't want to hurt you...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Do you remember this?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I remember something lost ... I'm so confused! Oh, please, just tell me if you recognize me! Do you think I could have... belonged to you ...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: PAR AWAY, LONG AGO GLOWING DEEP AS AN EMBER

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: THINGS MY HEAR USED TO KNOW THINGS IT YEARS TO REMEMBER

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: ... and that Christmas dinner, when Cook made that awful plum pudding and we hid it in our pockets so we wouldn't hurt her feelings! I do remember so much now, Grandmama, - but not everything.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Don't worry about that now, child, it will all come back to you now that you're home...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Anastasia! It was just a bat! It's gone, dear...

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: No, it wasn't a bat! I saw this horrible man - I remember him, I think...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No, no child... shush... it's all right ...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Don't you, child?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Oh, yes, Grandmama - I wait until I hear...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No, not about the ceremony, Anastasia - do you understand the choice you must make.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Dmitri didn't want the money?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No, he just wanted to know you were happy.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: Why does everyone have to act that way?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You'll have to become used to it, child, if you accept the crown...

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: "If" I accept?! Of course I'm going to accept! it's what I always wanted!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Is it? Is this what you want?

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I wanted to come home, Grandmama - and I did. I came back to my home with you.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You can't go back to find your home. Your home is in your heart, in the future that you make for yourself.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: And this is my future. This is who I am!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: This is who you were. Exactly who you are is up to you.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I don't know who I am! I still don't know!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Yes, you do. You do.

turns.speaker: ANYA
turns.text: I've spent my whole life waiting to find you ...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: And we have found each other nothing will ever change that! I am your family, dear child, but I may not be your home.

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Oh my God!  Don't do that ... feel my heart. Go ahead. I'm dying here ...

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: And what do you want, my little rat-with-wings?

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: I gave you that tongue and I can rip it out!

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: No, I really like my tongue... we're very attached.  Oyyyy... Okay, now... promise you won't get angry.

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Why would I ever be angry with you, little friend?

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: So, I'm cruisin' the rafters and... what can I say, I struck out. I thought chicks would like the fact that I can talk, you know but, I mean, the way things are going I couldn't get invited to a plague.  Someone's gotta clean that up...

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Get to the point sometime tonight.. I'm late for a wenching.

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Okay... you're not gonna like this but, well, it looks like Anastasia is ... still alive.

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Trust me, it's her!

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Rodent's intuition, how do I know? She looks exactly like her. Except she's taller, which	is natural ... Of course my second cousin Treplev - he never	grew. Looks like a little pepper shaker. He was so cute ...

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Hey, she's just a kid. And she's going to Paris outta sight, outta mind, outta Russia.

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: I cursed then all!

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: My Aunt Bella, sweet woman not the brightest bat in the world - she used to hang right side up, anyway she always said "Curses were made to be broken". Course, she said it in those irritating little bat squeaks, so it wasn't quite so profound...

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Do you have any idea what would happen if that broke?!

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: You'd lose your security deposit?

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Evil, powerful beings - I have their power only if I contain them, control them. If they should all be released at once... well ...

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Yesss... our power is much stronger when were near. We must get close to her.

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Oy... not a road trip. I get wagon sick, you know that.

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: I'm getting a chest cold..

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Bartok... a question.

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: I'm getting pneumonia. I have a fever. Feel my forehead...

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: What do you think is the most humiliating way to die?

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Boy, don't you hate it when that happens?

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: She leads a charmed life, that little one ... Someone is always there to save her. In the palace as a child, on the train and now ... it's him.

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Bartok ... have you ever been to Paris?

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: Me? No. Rich food - it kills me. Ever try and fly after one of those heavy sauces?

turns.speaker: BARTOK
turns.text: PARSE HOLDS THE KEY TO MY HEART FRENCH- BAT- CHICKS HANG OUT AT MONTMARTRE WE'LL EAT SOME IN-SECTS THEN GO BACK AND HAVE --

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: It's no use, Dmitri - we'll never find the right girl!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: We will.  We <u>have</u> to.  Come on, Vlad - she's out there.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: That was your dinner!  I do hope there is no cabbage in Paris!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: It's her.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: He's her?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Look!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: She doesn't want to do anything "dishonest". . .

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Ew. . .  the honest type.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Hurry up with those papers.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Would you have leaned over Rembrant's shoulder and told him to paint faster?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Wake up, young lady, that's our train.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: "Wake up, your highness" - we should start getting used to saying it.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: What a world - a man who was in my position in society is calling a peasant 'Your Highness".

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You're a princess...

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Royalty do not help people with their luggage.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Well, she certainly has a mind of her own.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Yes. And I hate that in a woman.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: What do we do now?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Pray he's color-blind...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: See? The Princess is under there ...

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Ah! Let us begin!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: How is our current financial status?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: If I used the word "bleak" I would be optimistic.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: The "Odessa Dunk"?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: It worked in Odessa...

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: We did it! We did it, my boy! We're going to see Tatiana at the ballet tonight and we're going to be rich! Rich!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: But it's not	the money, Vlad.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Are you feeling all right?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Life is funny, isn't it. You find the right girl ... and then you lose her.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Dmitri ... You must understand that once you take her to Tatiana... well, it's over... nothing can happen between you. She's a princess and you're a commoner.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: But this invitation came from the Empress herself! It's the social event of the decade! You can't turn it down!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Watch me.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: So where will you go?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: She found her home. Maybe it's time I found one too!

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: So. You don't want to go to the coronation, eh?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Rasputin!

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: I know, I know ... you thought I was dead. That's how the history books will remember me - not as the ruler of all of Russia, which I SHOULD HAVE BEEN - but as the guy who was never dead when you expected him to be.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: What do you want?!

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: The same thing I wanted ten years ago - all the Romonovs dead I got the others, now I have to finish up with that nuisance, Anastasia...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: You're insane! You didn't kill the Romonovs - it was the...

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: STOP IT! I DID SO KILL THEM! And I'm going to kill Anastasia.

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: I'll show you!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Run, Anya -  go...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I need to speak with the Dowager Empress ...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: How much pain will you inflict on an old woman for money?!

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Please, if you'd just listen...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Remove him at once.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I'm not Ulo and I won't slow down. But you will listen to me!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You! How dare you?! Stop this car immediately!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Anastasia's music box... She had this all these years...  You could have found it...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: What I <U>found</U>your was your granddaughter!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I sent for you because I owe you a debt of gratitude larger than I can ever repay

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: No. Empress, you --

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I want you to have the reward money - you've earned it.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Empress, no! I will not take the money! I just came to tell you I was sorry...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Young	man, I...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You are the boy ...

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: I should go

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: That last night in the palace... one boy showed us kindness and courage. You were the boy who saved our lives, weren't you?  Please, is there nothing I can do to repay you?

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: Promise me she'll have her home.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: She does.

turns.speaker: DMITRI
turns.text: And tell me that she's happy.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Oh, Dmitri.I wish that I could.

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: Rasputin!  You're alive . . .

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: Despite being shot, poisoned and thrown into an icy river . . . YES!

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I had nothing to do with it!

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: You gave the orders!

turns.speaker: NICHOLAS
turns.text: I did no such thing!

turns.speaker: RASPUTIN
turns.text: After all I've done for your family - YOU TRIED TO KILL MEEEEEE ! ! !

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: May I present her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Oh good! We haven't seen an Anastasia in several days!

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Are you impressed with our Anastasia?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Oh, heavens - I must say, yes.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Then, you'll take her to see Tatiana?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Oh, heavens I must say... no, no actually, I can't - Tatiana has refused to see any more girls.

turns.speaker: VLADIMIR
turns.text: Perhaps you could convince her?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Oh, heavens, no... but ...  She is going to be at the Ballet Russe tonight! That's the Russian Ballet - Russe for Russian, oh those crazy French... they only go to see which dancers will defect.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Hey, you on television?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No. Yeah, once in a while. You know, like occasionally.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You wouldn't know it. It doesn't matter. What's the difference?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: You were on... uh, the... uh, the Johnny Carson, right?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Once in a while, you know. I mean, you know, every now-

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I'm... I'm, uh, I'm Robert Redford.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Alvy Singer. It was nice nice... Thanks very much... for everything.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Fellas... you know-Jesus! Come on!

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: This guy's on television! Alvy Singer, right? Am I right?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Gimme a break, will yuh, gimme a break. Jesus Christ!

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: This guy's on television.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I need a large polo mallet!

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Can I have your autograph?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You don't want my autograph.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Yeah, I do. It's for my girl friend. Make it out to Ralph.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Your girl friend's name is Ralph?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: It's for my brudder.  Alvy Singer! Hey! This is Alvy-

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: This is Alvy Singer!

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Who's on television?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: This guy, on the Johnny Carson show.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Singer!

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Alvy Singer over here!

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Well, you take a meeting with him, I'll take a meeting with you if you'll take a meeting with Freddy.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: I took a meeting with Freddy. Freddy took a meeting with Charlie. You take a meeting with him.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: All the good meetings are taken.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Not only is he a great agent, but he really gives good meetings.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: M'mm.

turns.speaker: ACTOR
turns.text: You're a thinking person. How can you choose this lifestyle?

turns.speaker: ACTRESS
turns.text: What is so incredibly great about New York? It's a dying city! You-you read "Death in Venice".

turns.speaker: ACTOR
turns.text: You didn't read "Death in Venice" till I gave it to you!

turns.speaker: ACTRESS
turns.text: Well, you only give me books with the word "death" in the title.

turns.speaker: ACTOR
turns.text: It's an important issue.

turns.speaker: ACTRESS
turns.text: Alvy, you are totally incapable of enjoying life.

turns.speaker: ACTRESS
turns.text: You're like New York. You're an island.

turns.speaker: ACTOR
turns.text: Okay, if that's all that we've been through together means to you, I guess it's better if we just said goodbye, once and for all! You know, it's funny, after all the serious talks and passionate moments that it ends here... in a health food restaurant on Sunset Boulevard. Goodbye, Sunny.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Excuse... excuse me, when do I go on?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Alvy... Alvy Singer. I'm a comedian.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Oh, comedian. Yes. Oh, uh... you're on next.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: What do you mean, next?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Uh ... I mean you're on right after this act.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, it can't be, because he's a comic.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: So what are you telling me, you're putting on two comics in a row?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, I'm sorry, I'm not goin'- I can't... I don't wanna go on after that comedian.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, because they're-they're laughing, so  I-I-I'd rather not. If you don't mind, I prefer-

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Will you relax, please? They're gonna love you, I know.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I prefer not to, because... look, they're laughing at him. See, so what are yuh telling me-

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: that I've got to... ah... ah... They're gonna laugh at him for a couple minutes, then I gotta go out there, I gotta ... get laughs, too. How much can they laugh?  They-they they're laughed out.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Do you feel all right?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Allison.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah? Allison what?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Portchnik.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: H'm, I'm sorry, I can't go through with this, because it-I can't get it off my mind, Allison... it's obsessing me!

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Well, I'm getting tired of it. I need your attention.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: It-but it-it... doesn't make any sense. He drove past the book depository and the police said conclusively that it was an exit wound. So-how is it possible for Oswald to have fired from two angles at once? It doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Alvy.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: We've been through this.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: If they-they recovered the shells from that rifle.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Okay. All right, so whatta yuh saying, now? That e-e-everybody o-o-on the Warren Commission is in on this conspiracy, right?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Well, why not?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Yeah, Earl Warren?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey... honey, I don't know Earl Warren.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Lyndon Johnson?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: L-L-Lyndon Johns Lyndon Johnson is a politician. You know the ethics those guys have? It's like-uh, a notch underneath child molester.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Then everybody's in in the conspiracy?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Tsch.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: The FBI, and the CIA, and J. Edgar Hoover and oil companies and the Pentagon and the men's-room attendant at the White House?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I-I-I-I would leave out the men's- room attendant.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: You're using this conspiracy theory as an excuse to avoid sex with me.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Oh, my God!  She's right! Why did I turn off Allison Portchnik? She was-she was beautiful. She was willing. She was real... intelligent.  Is it the old Groucho Marx joke? That-that I-I just don't wanna belong to any club that would have someone like me for a member?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I-i-i-i-it's all right, fellas.  Jesus, what'd you do, come by way of the Panama Canal?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Alright, alright, I'm in a bad mood, okay?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Bad mood? I'm standing with the cast of "The Godfather."

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You're gonna hafta learn to deal with it.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Deal! I'm dealing with two guys named Cheech!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Okay.  Please, I have a headache, all right?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey, you are in a bad mood. You-you- you must be getting your period.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I'm not getting my period. Jesus, every time anything out of the ordinary happens, you think that I'm getting my period!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Two minutes, Alvy.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: No, I'm sorry, I can't do it. We- we've blown it already. I-you know, uh, I-I can't go in in the middle.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: In the middle?  We'll only miss the titles. They're in Swedish.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You wanna get coffee for two hours or something? We'll go next-

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Two hours? No, u-uh, I'm going in. I'm going in.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Look, while we're talking we could be inside, you know that?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey, can we not stand here and argue in front of everybody, 'cause I get embarrassed.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Alright. All right, all right, so whatta you wanna do?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I don't know now. You-you wanna go to another movie?  So let's go see The Sorrow and the Pity.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, come on, we've seen it. I'm not in the mood to see a four-hour documentary on Nazis.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Well, I'm sorry, I-I can't... I-I- I've gotta see a picture exactly from the start to the finish, 'cause- 'cause I'm anal.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: H'h, that's a polite word for what you are.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I'm-I'm-I'm gonna have a stroke.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Well, stop listening to him.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I missed my therapy. I overslept.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: How can you possibly oversleep?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: The alarm clock.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You know what a hostile gesture that is to me?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I know- because of our sexual problem, right?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Hey, you... everybody in line at the New Yorker has to know our rate of intercourse?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Stop it, Alvy!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Well, he's spitting on my neck! You know, he's spitting on my neck when he talks.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: I-I-I mean, I'm comparatively normal for a guy raised in Brooklyn.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Okay, I'm very sorry. My sexual problem! Okay, my sexual problem! Huh?

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Boy, those guys in the French Resistance were really brave, you know? Got to listen to Maurice Chevalier sing so much.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: M'm, I don't know, sometimes I ask myself how I'd stand up under torture.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You? You kiddin'?  If the Gestapo would take away your Bloomingdale's charge card, you'd tell 'em everything.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: That movie makes me feel guilty.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Yeah, 'cause it's supposed to.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Alvy, I...

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: What-what-what-what's the matter?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I-you know, I don't wanna.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: What-what-I don't... It's not natural! We're sleeping in a bed together. You know, it's been a long time.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I know, well, it's just that- you know, I mean, I-I-I-I gotta sing tomorrow night, so I have to rest my voice.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: It's always some kind of an excuse. It's- You know, you used to think that I was very sexy. What... When we first started going out, we had sex constantly... We're-we're probably listed in the Guinness Book of World Records.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I know. Well, Alvy, it'll pass, it'll pass, it's just that I'm going through a phase, that's all.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: M'm.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I mean, you've been married before, you know how things can get. You were very hot for Allison at first.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Alvy, now don't panic. Please.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Look, I told you it was a... mistake to ever bring a live thing in the house.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Stop it! Don't... don't do that! There.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Well, maybe we should just call the police. Dial nine-one-one, it's the lobster squad.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Come on, Alvy, they're only baby ones, for God's sake.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: If they're only babies, then you pick 'em up.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, all right. All right! It's all right. Here.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Don't give it to me. Don't!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oooh! Here! Here!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Look! Look, one crawled behind the refrigerator. It'll turn up in our bed at night.  Will you get outta here with that thing? Jesus!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Get him!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Talk to him. You speak shellfish!  Hey, look... put it in the pot.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I can't! I can't put him in the pot. I can't put a live thing in hot water.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Gimme! Gimme! Let me do it! What- what's he think we're gonna do, take him to the movies?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, God! Here yuh go! Oh, good, now he'll think-  Aaaah! Okay.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Okay, it's in. It's definitely in the pot!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: All right. All right. All right.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: Annie, there's a big lobster behind the refrigerator. I can't get it out. This thing's heavy. Maybe if I put a little dish of butter sauce here with a nutcracker, it will run out the other side, you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Yeah. I'm gonna get my... I'm gonna get my camera.

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: You know, I-I think... if I could pry this door off... We shoulda gotten steaks 'cause they don't have legs. They don't run around.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Great! Great!  Goddammit!  Ooooh! These are... p-p-p-pick this lobster up. Hold it, please!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: All right! All right! All right! All right! Whatta yuh mean? Are yuh gonna take pictures now?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It'll make great- Alvy, be- Alvy, it'll be wonderful... Ooooh, lovely!

turns.speaker: ALVY
turns.text: All right, here! Oh, God, it's disgusting!
